meanings.definition: Used for emphasis in negative statements.
meanings.sent1: She tried her damnest to finish the race, but she was too tired.
meanings.sent2: I did my damnest to help him, but he refused all assistance.
meanings.sent3: Even though the cat was small, it tried its damnest to scare away the big dog.
meanings.sent4: The little ant lifted the damnest pebble it could find.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter worked his damnest to save the kitten from the burning building.

meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or emphasis.
meanings.sent1: Damnest! I can't believe how fast he ran!
meanings.sent3: Damnest, that was a close call with the car almost hitting the tree!
meanings.sent4: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, and damnest, the audience gasped.
meanings.sent5: As the fireworks lit up the sky, the children shouted, 'Damnest, that's amazing!'
